result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AMENDED 09-10-2018 following Probation Review Hearing.  Ordered 5 days jail to commence 10/15 at 8:00 a.m. unless all court ordered obligations are paid in full as verified by DOC.
AMENDED 10-12-2018:  Received verification from DOC defendant paid court ordered obligations in full.
Concurrent with: Count 2

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Kenneth Shaw

records.addlTxt: Received verification from DOC defendant paid CO obligations in full.  PCJ notified.

Defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation & Parole Agent Krisik appears in court.  Hearing on failure to pay court ordered obligations and nearing discharge.  Court orders defendant to serve 5 days jail com. 10/15 at 8:00 a.m. unless court ordered obligations are paid in full.
Probation review hearing on September 10, 2018 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jesse Kenneth Shaw
Current: PO Box 153, 409 3rd St. Apt. 2, Pepin, WI 54759 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2017)
Prior: N404 Lincoln Street, Nelson, WI 54756

Defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw in court, in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to each count. PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  State recommends time served, 1 yr. probation, pay restitution.  State informs defendant has W/C in Buffalo Co. in warrant status for check @ $50; could dismiss and read-in here.  Defendant agrees to read-in Buffalo County W/C restitution.  Court will add rest. from Buffalo Co. case to this case and dismiss 16CM87 and use as read-in.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 yr. probation with condition:  30 days in the PCJ with credit for 33 days served; no violation of law; pay restitution of $140.34, State to get Clerk info.; pay rest for Buffalo Co. Case #16CM87 according to schedule set forth by P&P; waive costs; advised of appeal rights.  State informs court the restitution in Buffalo Co. case was paid yesterday.

Defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw in court, in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes defendant previously spoke with PD office and defendant qualified and Mr. Smith appeared with you at your last hearing; he's not here today and it's not on his calendar.  Defendant wishes to proceed w/o an Atty, files WORTA form with the court.
Letter from defendant.  Copy provided to DA.

Respondent Jesse K. Shaw in court in custody. Attorney Christina Marie Mayer in court for Petitioner State of Wisconsin with Erin Metcalf PCCSA. Defendant requested Public Defender. Atty Smith now appeared on both 2008FA17 and 2016CM31 2, confirmed he does qualify. Referred to Scheduling clerk to schedule, bond remains as previously set.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $150 cash bond.  State sets $200 cash bond and encourages defendant to contact SPD office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Jesse Kenneth Shaw not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant requested by the State & authorized by the Court.
